page.title: 10SPRINGHEAD NEAR STUBHAMPTON
page.content: The Springhead Trust is a day and residential study centre established in 1973 to commemorate the work of Rolf Gardiner. It is set in old mill buildings on a site in Fontmell Magna dating to before the first Domesday Book. Its aims encompass a wholistic approach to man and his relationship to the environment. Educational courses are run for groups, local and distant, of school and adult ages, ranging from retreats and meditation through art, craft and drama to detailed rural studies. All stress the vital link between man and the Earth he inhabits. The Trust is also deeply involved in the local community through folk dance, local history, job creation, the linking of volunteer organisations and education.
